events.comment:
This external event sheet is the primary Finite State Machine (FSM) for the hero character.
This functions using an object variable on the Hero object, named heroFSM.
The main goal is to ensure that only the actions that *should* occur, *can* occur. 
Example: 
-The player has jump, attack, and dash buttons available to them. If the player is dashing, they should not be able to attack mid-dash. 
--Without a FSM, the attack events would then have to have extra conditions added to ensure it won't work while dashing. Then the same would need to be done for jump. As the hero also can't run while dashing, more conditions would need to be adde to the run events to avoid that there too. Every potential conflict will add more and more bloat to the events, and lead to potential logic or animation conflicts. 
--With a FSM, when the hero switches to the Dash State, the events simply do not set up any controls for jump, run, or attack, and they are ignored during the dash.

Learn more about FSMs here: 
http://wiki.compilgames.net/doku.php/gdevelop5/tutorials/finite_state_machine
https://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/tutorials/finite-state-machines-theory-and-implementation--gamedev-11867
The initialization state occurs at the beginning of the scene just to ensure there's no oddness when the scene begins.
If the game is in Cutscene mode, the hero shouldn't be able to use its normal states.
If the game is NOT in cutscene mode, the hero should switch to whatever state the heroFSM variable is set to.
